manpage.title: getchar, getwchar

description.para: The getchar, getwchar functions obtain the next input character (if present) from standard input stream. getchar function is equivalent to getc(stdin).

return.para: These functions return the character read. To indicate an read error or end-of-file condition, getchar returns EOF and getwchar returns WEOF.

remarks.para: Each of these routines reads a single character from stdin at the current position and increments stream pointer to point to the next character.
getwchar is the wide-character version of getchar.

tr.td: Can run as a function or macro.
Wide-character version of getchar. Reads a multibyte character or a wide character according to whether stream is opened in text mode or binary mode.
